intro: Elatostema multicanaliculatum, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed elatostema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically found in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its delicate appearance and unique leaf structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
